ctus.text: The welfare scheme known as 25% Capital Investment Subsidy Scheme, or 25%CISS, aims to support the economic development of the Union Territory of Lakshadweep. Due to the declaration of Lakshadweep as a "No industrial Area," the focus is on establishing Small-Scale Industrial units to create self-employment opportunities. Specific studies conducted by the Planning Commission identified the need to accelerate Start-up Industries in Lakshadweep. As a result, the Government of India approved the implementation of the 25% Capital Investment Subsidy scheme to promote Micro and Small Enterprises in the region. The objective of the scheme is to generate employment opportunities in the private sector and facilitate local entrepreneurs in setting up viable ventures in Lakshadweep.

The Industrial Promotion & Economic Development scheme in Lakshadweep targets individuals as beneficiaries and is implemented by the Department Of Industries, Kavaratti, with the nodal department being Industries Department, Lakshadweep. Eligible entrepreneurs can receive financial assistance of 25% of the total enterprise cost, up to a maximum of ₹25 lakhs, covering land, machinery, and construction. Individuals above 18 years, including women, ex-servicemen, and physically handicapped individuals, can apply for the scheme. New Micro or Small units engaged in manufacturing or servicing, except for activities on the Negative List, can claim the 25% Capital Investment Subsidy in Lakshadweep. Only Micro Enterprises/Units with investments below ₹00 lakhs in Plant & Machinery and Building are eligible under this scheme. Institutions registered under the Societies Registration Act 1960 and Self-Help Groups that have not received financial benefits from other schemes can also avail of the 25% Capital Investment Subsidy.

The processing and manufacturing of items like Beedi, Pan, Cigarettes, Polythene carry bags under 20 Microns, and containers made of recycled plastic for food storage are industries causing environmental issues. The application process involves advertising the scheme annually through the Panchayat Raj Institution and Lakshadweep website to attract entrepreneurs. Newly established entrepreneurs must submit their application forms to the Department of Industries along with supporting documents. Island level committees chaired by DCs/SDOs verify claims and inspect units before forwarding details to the Director of Industries. District level scrutinizing committees then review the information and recommend subsidies to beneficiaries based on guidelines. For more information, refer to the official website and guidelines provided.

In line with the decision made by the Standing Committee of the Island Development Authority, specific studies were carried out by the Planning Commission, leading to the formation of an Expert Committee. This Committee addressed the challenges of Industrialization in Lakshadweep and identified the unique requirements to boost Start-up Industries in the region. As per the expert committee's recommendations, the Government of India has sanctioned the implementation of a scheme known as the 25% Capital Investment Subsidy to support local entrepreneurs in promoting Micro and Small Enterprises in Lakshadweep. This initiative aims to enhance industrialization and empower local entrepreneurs and unemployed youth to establish viable ventures in the Islands. The scheme's objectives include promoting Micro and Small Enterprises, creating job opportunities in the private sector, and fostering industrial promotion and economic development in the islands. Under this scheme, eligible entrepreneurs can receive financial assistance equivalent to 25% of the total enterprise cost, up to a maximum of ₹6.25 lakhs, covering expenses like land, machinery, and construction.

The Committee learned about problems of Industrialization in these Islands and identified special needs that would accelerate the Start-up Industries in Lakshadweep. Based on the recommendation of the expert committee, Govt. of India has approved the implementation of a scheme called 25% Capital Investment Subsidy to the local entrepreneurs for promoting Micro and Small Enterprises in Lakshadweep. This scheme paves the way to improve industrialization and to facilitate local entrepreneurs/unemployed youth to take up viable ventures (Micro & Small Enterprises) in the Islands."}]}]}, {" type": The Island level Committee, chaired by DCs/SDOs, will verify claims and inspect Units before forwarding them to the Director, Industries in the prescribed format, including bills from the Entrepreneur. The Island Level Committees for all islands except Bitra consist of a Deputy Collector/SDO as Chairman, an Assistant Engineer (PWD) as Member, a Senior Auditor/JAO, FPU as Member, and the senior most Supervisor from the Department of Industries as Member. For Bitra, the Committee includes an Assistant Engineer (PWD) as Chairman, an Authorised Officer from Bitra as Member, and an Executive Officer from the Panchayat as Member. The District Level Scrutinising Committee, chaired by the Secretary (Industries), includes the Accounts Officer(1), DP as Member, the Superintending Engineer, LPWD as Member, the Director (Plg. & Stats) as Member, and the Director of Industries as Member. The District Level Committee verifies details from the Island Level Committee and recommends subsidy amounts to Beneficiaries according to guidelines.

To submit the same, the Director of Industries should be contacted in the specified format ([Annexure-IV](https://cdn.s3waas.gov.in/s358238e9ae2dd305d79c2ebc8c1883422/uploads/2019/08/2019082183.pdf)) with all details and bills from the Entrepreneur. The Island Level Committees, excluding Bitra, consist of the Deputy Collector/SDOs as Chairman, Assistant Engineer (PWD) as Member, Senior Auditor/JAO, FPU as Member, and the senior most Supervisor from the Department of Industries as Member. For Bitra, the committee includes the Assistant Engineer (PWD) as Chairman, Authorised Officer Bitra as Member, and Executive Officer from the Panchayat as Member. The District Level Scrutinising Committee is chaired by the Secretary (Industries) with members including the Accounts Officer(1), DP, Superintending Engineer, LPWD, Director (Plg. & Stats), and Director of Industries. The District Level Committee (DLC) will review the information provided by the Island Level Committee and suggest the subsidy amount for the Beneficiary as per the guidelines.

A "New Industrial Unit" refers to any Micro or Small Industrial unit established in the islands with an investment not exceeding ₹25.00 Lakhs, covering the cost of building, plants, and machinery. To be eligible for subsidy benefits in this scheme, the unit must be registered under this Department/online Udyog Aadhaar portal of M/O MSME/otherwise. Expansion, modernization, and diversification investments are not eligible under this scheme. The definition of "Building" includes the actual price of the building/built-up areas required for industrial units, assessed/certified by the Competent Authority. "Plant & Machinery" encompasses the actual cost of machines, equipment, and tools, with transportation charges, erection cost, etc. considered for investment calculation, limited to the approved rate.

Only taxes paid bills are eligible for subsidy. A GST Number is not required for Plants and Machinery purchased before the introduction of GST in July 2017. The definition of Plant & Machinery includes the actual cost of machines, equipment, and tools, along with transportation charges and erection costs, limited to approved rates. Second-hand machinery purchased from any industrial unit cannot be considered for a 25% Capital Investment Subsidy. Individuals above 18 years of age, including Women, ex-servicemen, and physically handicapped, are eligible to apply under the scheme. New Micro or Small units engaged in manufacturing/servicing, except those in the Negative List, can claim a 25% Capital Investment Subsidy in Lakshadweep Islands, with Micro Enterprises/Units eligible if the investment in Plant & Machinery and Building is below ₹25.00 Lakhs.

To be eligible for subsidy under this scheme, entities must file the Entrepreneurs Memorandum Part-II (Permanent Registration) under the MSME Act 2006 with the Director of Industries, U.T. of Lakshadweep or obtain Udyog Aadhar registration. Institutions registered under the Societies Registration Act 1960 and Self-Help Groups that have not received financial benefits from any other scheme can avail a 25% Capital Investment Subsidy. The scheme operates in all inhabited islands of Lakshadweep. Activities such as processing/preparing intoxicated items and manufacturing polythene carry bags of less than 20 Microns thickness are not permitted under the subsidy program. Eligibility criteria include individuals above 18 years of age, new Micro or Small units engaged in manufacturing/servicing (excluding activities in the Negative List), Micro Enterprises/Units with investments below ₹25.00 Lakhs, and entities with specific registrations as mentioned.
